config.text:
Welcome to NOAA's Deep-sea Corals and

Sponges data discovery tool


For questions, or to submit feedback, please email us at deepseacoraldata@noaa.gov. Official metadata and citation information for the National Database for Deep-sea Corals and Sponges can be found at:  https://deepseacoraldata.noaa.gov/data


Please read the important information below regarding the use of data from this portal:


This data portal and the data delivered therein is not an official communication of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) or the United States Department of Commerce. All data provided through this portal is offered on an 'as is' basis, and the user assumes responsibility for its use. Any claims against the Department of Commerce or its bureaus arising from the use of this data portal will be governed by applicable Federal law. Any reference to specific commercial products, processes, or services by service mark, trademark, manufacturer, or otherwise, does not constitute or imply endorsement, recommendation, or favoring by the Department of Commerce. The Department of Commerce seal and logo, or the seal and logo of any DOC bureau, shall not be used in any manner to imply endorsement of any commercial product or activity by the DOC or the United States Government.﻿

config.text: ﻿Filters for limiting the displayed records are located in the panel left of the map. The "Scientific Name" filter allows you to type in the scientific name of interest. It will "autocomplete', displaying all options beginning with the characters you typed. Other filters are available in the "Basic", "Taxon", "Text", and "Models" tabs below. The "Taxon" filters are intended to operate from the most general to the most specific and only offer choices pertinent to the previous selections. Unlike the other two tabs, the "Models" tab does not filter the sample records, but instead filters the display of model output predicting the location of specified species. Multiple filters can be applied simultaneously and note that is it possible to have a combination of filters which do not match any records. ﻿
config.placeholder: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

config.text:
The panel on the right side of the map has two tabs, "Detail" and "Summary". The Detail tab allows you to page through every available record given the current map extent and any filters that have been applied. You can toggle between the tabs by clicking on the titles "Detail" and "Summary" respectively. The Summary tab displays data aggregated by fixed hexagonal areas, aka "hexbins".


If you select a point on the map, the Detail tab will display the corresponding record (note that this may take a few seconds). Switching to the Summary tab will show summary information for the hexbin containing the selected record.


If you click on a location which is covered by a hexbin but does not intersect a point, the Summary tab will automatically be selected. If you click on a location not covered by a hexbin, no summary information will be displayed but you will still be able to page through active records in the Detail tab.
